top_categories.workout_context: 404 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 404 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
26,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Migration Gravel Race's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
Migration Gravel Race's Red volcanic dust, hard-packed savanna trails forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 404 miles.
404 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
At Migration Gravel Race, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
26,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
64ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 26,000ft of climbing on red volcanic dust and savanna trails does to your power file on race day.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Migration Gravel Race. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Migration Gravel Race, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.

race_overlay.heat: June in Maasai Mara, Kenya — 15-30°C (59-86°F), equatorial sun, possible afternoon storms. Heat + altitude combination that compounds daily. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Migration Gravel Race — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day. Race-day realities: Equatorial sun at altitude; Heat + UV + altitude = dehydration risk that compounds daily.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 404 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 404 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Migration Gravel Race with 26,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. Equatorial sun at altitude; Heat + UV + altitude = dehydration risk that compounds daily.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Migration Gravel Race requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on red volcanic dust and savanna trails to build confidence. Expect: red volcanic dust, hard-packed savanna trails, game reserve roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Endurance, and VO2max to prepare you for 404 miles of red volcanic dust and savanna trails in Maasai Mara, Kenya.
